required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Turoctocog Alfa in Previously Treated Male Children With Haemophilia A
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Centre, Open-Label, Non-Controlled Trial on Safety and Efficacy of N8 in Previously Treated Paediatric Patients With Haemophilia A

oversight_info.authority: Macedonia, The Former Yugoslav Republic of: Ministry of Health of Republic of Macedonia
Russia: Federal Service for Control of Health Care and Social Development
Serbia: Agency for Drugs and Medicinal Devices
United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: This trial is conducted in Asia, Europe, and North and South America. The aim of this clinical trial is to investigate the safety and efficacy of turoctocog alfa (recombinant factor VIII, rFVIII (N8)) in male previously treated paediatric subjects with haemophilia A.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: The Incidence Rate of FVIII Inhibitors (Greater Than or Equal to 0.6 Bethesda Units (BU))
primary_outcome.time_frame: The adverse events were collected throughout the trial, corresponding to an average of 138 days per subject.
primary_outcome.description: The incidence rate of FVIII inhibitors was calculated by including all patients with inhibitors in the nominator and including all patients with a minimum 50 exposure plus any patients with less than 50 exposures but with inhibitors in denominator.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The adverse events were collected throughout the trial, corresponding to an average of 138 days per subject
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse event was defined as events occurring after administration of trial product. Severe AEs: considerable interference with subject's daily activities, unacceptable. Moderate AEs: Marked symptoms, moderate interference with the patient's daily activities. Mild AEs: No or transient symptoms, no interference with the patient's daily activities. Serious AE: AE that at any dose results in any of the following: death, a life-threatening experience, in-subject hospitalization/prolongation of existing hospitalisation, persistent/significant disability/incapacity/congenital anomaly/birth defect.

intervention.description: Subjects will be treated 3 times per week or every second day with intravenous injections of turoctocog alfa. The dose range for preventive treatment is 25-60 IU/kg body weight depending on treatment regimen.

Subjects will undergo half-life evaluation of their current factor VIII product and pharmacokinetic session with turoctocog alfa before entering preventive treatment (subjects with available evaluation of terminal half-life within the last year are to be excluded from receiving factor VIII). Intravenous injections. The dose range for preventive treatment is 25-60 IU/kg body weight depending on treatment regimen.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male patients with severe (baseline FVIII less than or equal to 1%) haemophilia A
- Age below 12 years and weight at least 11 kg
Exclusion Criteria:
- Surgery planned to occur during trial participation (exceptions are port placement, dental extractions, and minor, uncomplicated emergent procedures)
- Congenital or acquired coagulation disorders other than haemophilia A
- Any history of FVIII inhibitors (greater than or equal to 0.6 BU/mL)

address.country: Macedonia, The Former Yugoslav Republic of

location_countries.country: Macedonia, The Former Yugoslav Republic of

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Of a total of 39 initiated trial sites, 26 sites enrolled and dosed at least one patient. The country distribution was as follows: Brazil (3), Italy (1), Lithuania (1), Macedonia (1), Malaysia (1), Poland (2), Russia (2), Serbia (1), Taiwan (1), Turkey (3) and the United States of America (10).

group.title: All Subjects Treated With Turoctocog Alfa
group.description: The patients received bleeding preventive treatment with a single dose of turoctocog alfa of 25-50 IU/kg every second day or 25-60 IU/kg three times weekly. Turoctocog alfa was administered as a slow bolus i.v. injection (approximately 1-2 mL/min). Pharmacokinetic assessments were performed in at least 13 patients from each age cohort. Each patient participating in the pharmacokinetic assessments received one dose of previous factor VIII (FVIII) and one dose of turoctocog alfa.

participants_list.participants: Two subjects withdrew consent after being enrolled but before receiving any trial product.

group.title: All Subjects Treated With Turoctocog Alfa
group.description: The patients received bleeding preventive treatment with a single dose of turoctocog alfa of 25-50 IU/kg every second day or 25-60 IU/kg three times weekly. Turoctocog alfa was administered as a slow bolus i.v. injection (approximately 1-2 mL/min). Pharmacokinetic assessments were performed in at least 13 patients from each age cohort. Each patient participating in the pharmacokinetic assessments received one dose of previous factor VIII (FVIII) and one dose of turoctocog alfa.

category.sub_title: Macedonia, The Former Yugoslav Republic of

outcome.title: The Incidence Rate of FVIII Inhibitors (Greater Than or Equal to 0.6 Bethesda Units (BU))
outcome.description: The incidence rate of FVIII inhibitors was calculated by including all patients with inhibitors in the nominator and including all patients with a minimum 50 exposure plus any patients with less than 50 exposures but with inhibitors in denominator.
outcome.time_frame: The adverse events were collected throughout the trial, corresponding to an average of 138 days per subject.
outcome.population: The safety analysis set includes all 63 subjects who received at least one dose of the investigational product. The analysis of the primary endpoint included all subjects with at least 50 exposure days and/or with inhibitors. A total of 59 subjects had 50 exposure days (EDs).

group.title: All Subjects Treated With Turoctocog Alfa

Each patient participating in the pharmacokinetic assessments received one dose of previous factor VIII (FVIII) and one dose of turoctocog alfa.

measure.title: The Incidence Rate of FVIII Inhibitors (Greater Than or Equal to 0.6 Bethesda Units (BU))
measure.description: The incidence rate of FVIII inhibitors was calculated by including all patients with inhibitors in the nominator and including all patients with a minimum 50 exposure plus any patients with less than 50 exposures but with inhibitors in denominator.
measure.units: N with Inhibitors / N with ≥50 EDs

outcome.title: Frequency of Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: Adverse event was defined as events occurring after administration of trial product. Severe AEs: considerable interference with subject's daily activities, unacceptable. Moderate AEs: Marked symptoms, moderate interference with the patient's daily activities. Mild AEs: No or transient symptoms, no interference with the patient's daily activities. Serious AE: AE that at any dose results in any of the following: death, a life-threatening experience, in-subject hospitalization/prolongation of existing hospitalisation, persistent/significant disability/incapacity/congenital anomaly/birth defect.
outcome.time_frame: The adverse events were collected throughout the trial, corresponding to an average of 138 days per subject
outcome.population: Safety analysis set includes all subjects who received at least one dose of the investigational product.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Novo Nordisk maintains the right to be informed of any Investigator plans for publication and to review any scientific paper, presentation, communication or other information concerning the investigation described in this protocol.
